attributes.comment:
Regarding the USCIS proposed increase in fees:
I-600/600A
Petition to Classify Orphan as an Immediate Relative
$ 545
$ 670

N-565
Application for Replacement of Certificate of Citizenship (used for
name changes)
$ 220
$ 380

N-600
Application for Certificate of Citizenship
$ 255
$ 460

Biometric Services (fingerprints)
$ 70
$ 80

I am against raising the fees for adopting children from overseas. Adoption is expensive enough
without a 66% increase in fees, some for repeating fingerprints that expire during the wait for a
child. If the quality of service went up 66%, then I could understand the desire to increase fees, but
this is an unreasonably high increase put on the backs of people who are trying to give children a
chance at life. I have adopted twice from overseas, and it's very time consuming, cumbersome,
and expensive to adopt as is, complicated when agencies don't follow the law or their own
guidelines or request resubmission of fingerprints and applications and such during a lengthy and
stressful wait for a child. For the services given, I actually believe the fees should go down, not up,
but at least they should not be raised, causing further financial strain on U.S. citizens forming their
families and willingly opening their hearts and homes to needy children. These fee increases do not
serve U.S. citizens well.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Susanna M. Harter
